intro: Satureja cymuligera, commonly known as the mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pink or purple flowers in clusters. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic and antiseptic properties. Satureja cymuligera thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rocky or alpine gardens.
